Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the speed at which Obama is trying to pass the health care reform bill by comparing it to the time it took him to choose a family dog.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the comparison between picking a dog and passing health care reform.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the time taken to choose a family dog is directly comparable to the time needed to pass a complex health care reform bill.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative reasons for the perceived speed at which Obama is trying to pass the health care reform bill, such as the urgency of addressing healthcare issues or political considerations.
